Package ru.nsu.gaskov

Class HeapSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.nsu.gaskov.HeapSort
  • public class HeapSort
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static methods for performing heap sort on arrays of various types.

    Heap sort is a comparison-based sorting algorithm that uses a binary heap data structure. It is efficient for large datasets and has a time complexity of O(n log n) in the average and worst cases. The space complexity is O(1) since it sorts the array in place.

    This class includes methods for sorting arrays of primitive types (such as int, double, and char) as well as object arrays. It also supports custom sorting through comparators for user-defined types.

    Note: The input arrays are modified in place, and the original order of equal elements is not necessarily preserved (unstable sort).

    • Method Detail

      • heapsort

        public static <T> void heapsort​(T[] a,
                                int fromIndex,
                                int toIndex,
                                java.util.Comparator<? super T> c)
        Sorts the specified array using the heap sort algorithm with a custom comparator. This method transforms the array into a heap and then extracts the largest elements in order to sort the array.

        The array is sorted in-place, meaning no additional arrays are created during the sorting process.

        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort
        fromIndex - the starting index of the portion of the array to sort (inclusive)
        toIndex - the end index of the portion of the array to sort (exclusive)
        c - the comparator used to compare array elements

      • heapsort

        public static void heapsort​(java.lang.Object[] a,
                            int fromIndex,
                            int toIndex)
        Sorts the specified array using the heap sort algorithm. This method transforms the array into a heap and then extracts the largest elements in order to sort the array using the natural ordering of elements.

        The array is sorted in-place, meaning no additional arrays are created during the sorting process.

        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort
        fromIndex - the starting index of the portion of the array to sort (inclusive)
        toIndex - the end index of the portion of the array to sort (exclusive)

      • heapsort

        public static void heapsort​(byte[] a,
                            int fromIndex,
                            int toIndex)
        Sorts the segment of the array using the heap sort algorithm. This method transforms the array into a heap and then extracts the largest elements in order to sort the array.

        The array is sorted in-place, meaning no additional arrays are created during the sorting process.

        The specific implementation of this method depends on the type of the array: it can handle byte, short, int, long, float, double, and char arrays.

        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort
        fromIndex - the starting index of the portion of the array to sort (inclusive)
        toIndex - the end index of the portion of the array to sort (exclusive)

      • heapsort

        public static <T> void heapsort​(T[] a,
                                java.util.Comparator<? super T> c)
        Sorts the whole specified array using the heap sort algorithm and a custom comparator. This method initializes the sorting process on the entire array, allowing for custom ordering of the elements.

        The sorting is performed in-place without using additional storage.

        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort
        c - the comparator used to compare array elements

      • heapsort

        public static void heapsort​(java.lang.Object[] a)
        Sorts the whole specified array using the heap sort algorithm. This method initializes the sorting process on the entire array, relying on the natural ordering of the elements.

        The sorting is performed in-place without using additional storage.

        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort

      • heapsort

        public static void heapsort​(byte[] a)
        Sorts the whole array using the heap sort algorithm. This method sorts the entire array in-place, meaning no additional arrays are created during the sorting process.

        The specific implementation of this method depends on the type of the array, which can be byte, short, int, long, float, double, or char.

        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort
